oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of the Tennessee group on the Gold Star Pilgrimage
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The Ring family of Franklin, Tenn., provided three of their four sons to the Army in WWI. The third oldest, Pvt. Frank M. Ring, Co. A, 114th MG Battn., 30th Div., was killed in Oct., 1918. In the early 1930s the US government offered trips to Gold Star Widows and Mothers to visit the graves of their loved ones. Sarah Frances M. Ring and her daughter, Emma Mai Ring, made the pilgrimage in 1933 and is pictured with other Tennesseans and the ship's captain that transported them to Europe.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Ring, Sarah Frances M.; Ring, Emma Mai
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
